avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow has widely settled and thawed in warm conditions and therefore stabilized. Risk of slip and slide in icy conditions high in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted considerably in last weeks warming. A snowpit from the region showed homogenous melt-freeze snow with ice lenses between layers. Temperature fluctuations are expected for this week in mild E winds and minor snowfall is expected on Tuesday and Friday. The snowpack is widely isothermal and homogenous but slippery conditions could be dangerous as the snow is mostly frozen in the mountains.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in north- to northeasterly winds but NE snowfall is also ongoing in the Tröllaskagi region. Wind slabs have therefore widely grown in S-W facing aspects. A lot of snow melted last week after a warming episode and the snowpack is widely stable in the south and west of the country where new snow has not fallen.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in north- to northeasterly winds but NE snowfall is also ongoing in the Tröllaskagi region. Wind slabs have widely grown in S-W facing aspects.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA 5-10 m/sek víða til fjalla en úrkomulaust. Búist er við lítilsháttar snjókomu í austlægum áttum snemma á föstudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: There have been no reports of avalanches last seven days.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow on Tuesday and expected on Wednesday. The older snow is considered mostly stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow on Tuesday and expected on Wednesday. A significant amount of snow melted during last week"s warm weather. Snow stakes indicate that the snowpack has generally reached isothermal conditions after the warmth. It can be expected that it has further consolidated in the cold weather and overnight frost this week.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in north- to northeasterly winds but NE snowfall is also ongoing in the Tröllaskagi region. Wind slabs have therefore widely grown in S-W facing aspects. A lot of snow melted last week after a warming episode and the snowpack is widely stable in the south and west of the country where new snow has not fallen.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in north- to northeasterly winds but NE snowfall is also ongoing in the Tröllaskagi region. Wind slabs have widely grown in S-W facing aspects.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA-átt á miðvikudag og lítilsháttar snjókoma. Þurrt á fimmtudag. Útlit fyrir A-átt með snjókomu á föstudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier triggered a wet loose avalanche in Hrafnaskál last week during a warming episode. Few slabs also fell in Siglufjörður and more loose avalanches in Ólafsfjörður early last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: E- to NE snowfall is expected to continue throughout Wednesday and snow could drift and form wind slabs in SW facing hills. Older snowpack is considered homogenous and stable but PWL could still be present high in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack has strengthened during warming in all elevations since last week and overnight freezing after the weekend. Hardpack snow is widespread and the older snowpack is considered widely homogenous and stable. Diurnal temperature fluctuations affect surface snow on S-aspects where solar effect is greatest. It has snowed a bit in E-winds is expected and that will continue throughout Wednesday and snow could drift into southwestern facing hills.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in north- to northeasterly winds but NE snowfall is also ongoing in the Tröllaskagi region. Wind slabs have therefore widely grown in S-W facing aspects. A lot of snow melted last week after a warming episode and the snowpack is widely stable in the south and west of the country where new snow has not fallen.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in north- to northeasterly winds but NE snowfall is also ongoing in the Tröllaskagi region. Wind slabs have widely grown in S-W facing aspects.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi snjókoma er væntanleg í norðaustlægum áttum út miðvikudag. Lítilsháttar éljabakkar á fimmtudag en styttir síðan upp með föstudeginum. Hiti við frostmark á láglendi en frystir til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Rather small slab avalanches released 6th March due to solar radiation in highest mountains in Fjarðarheiði and around Seyðisfjörður. When temperature rose on Monday several avalanches released in the forecasting area.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Lot of new snow in E-wind on Tuesday. Lot of new snow expected on Wednesday in N-wind.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Higher up in the mountains, there may be old wind slabs and layered snow that previous thawing hasn"t had time to settle. In the lower parts of the mountains the snow should generally be stable. Lot of new snow in E-wind on Tuesday. Lot of new snow expected on Wednesday in N-wind.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in north- to northeasterly winds but NE snowfall is also ongoing in the Tröllaskagi region. Wind slabs have therefore widely grown in S-W facing aspects. A lot of snow melted last week after a warming episode and the snowpack is widely stable in the south and west of the country where new snow has not fallen.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot has snowed in the Eastfjords in north- to northeasterly winds but NE snowfall is also ongoing in the Tröllaskagi region. Wind slabs have widely grown in S-W facing aspects.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snýst í N-átt með áframhaldandi snjókomu á miðvikudag en rigningu á láglendi. Úrkomulítið á fimmtudag og minnkandi N-átt, kólnandi. Hægur vindur og úrkomulaust á föstudag.
